alert.note: Alert for Armstrong; Carson; Collingsworth; Dallam; Deaf Smith; Donley; Gray; Hansford; Hartley; Hutchinson; Moore; Oldham; Palo Duro Canyon; Potter; Randall; Sherman (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued May 07 at 2:50PM CDT until May 09 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS Amarillo
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM CDT THIS EVENING FOR STRONG WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR THE WESTERN TWO THIRDS OF THE OKLAHOMA AND TEXAS PANHANDLES... ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM SUNDAY TO 1 AM CDT MONDAY FOR STRONG WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR THE ENTIRETY OF THE OKLAHOMA AND TEXAS PANHANDLES... The National Weather Service in Amarillo has issued a Red Flag Warning for strong winds and low relative humidity, which is in effect from 10 AM Sunday to 1 AM CDT Monday. This replaces the Fire Weather Watch previously in effect for Sunday. Meanwhile, a Red Flag Warning remains in effect this afternoon and evening through 10 PM CDT. * Affected Area...In Oklahoma...Cimarron and Texas. In Texas... Dallam...Sherman...Hansford...Hartley...Moore...Hutchinson... Oldham...Potter...Carson...Gray...Deaf Smith...Randall... Armstrong...Donley...Collingsworth and Palo Duro Canyon. * 20 Foot Winds...Saturday, southwest 15 to 25 mph with gusts to 40 mph. Sunday, southwest 20 to 30 mph with gusts up to 45 mph. * Relative Humidity...Saturday, as low as 4 percent. Sunday, as low as 4 percent. * Red Flag Threat Index...Saturday, 4 to 7. Sunday, 4 to 8. * Timing...Saturday through 10 PM. For Sunday`s Red Flag Warning, 10 AM CDT until 1 AM CDT very early Monday morning.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now...or will shortly. A combination of strong winds...low relative humidity...and warm temperatures will create favorable weather for rapid fire growth and spread. Avoid activities that promote open flames and sparks.
